                if node.left:
                    quene.append(node.left)
                if node.right:
                    quene.append(node.right)

            res.append(temp[-1])

        # return res

        # DFS æ ¹--ã€‹å³--ã€‹å·¦ 
        # def dfs(root, depth):
        #     if not root:
        #         return

        #     if len(res) == depth:
        #         res.append(root.val)

        #     depth += 1
        #     dfs(root.right, depth)
        #     dfs(root.left, depth)

        # res = []
        # dfs(root,0)
        # return res

6.2 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

6.2.1 è·¯å¾„æ€»å’Œ(No.112)

class Solution112:
    def hasPathSum(self, root: Optional[TreeNode], targetSum: int) -> bool:
        # DFS
        def dfs(root,target):
            if not root: return False
            if not root.left and not root.right:
                return target == root.val

            target -= root.val
            left = dfs(root.left, target)
            right = dfs(root.right, target)
            return left or right

        return dfs(root,targetSum)

6.2.2 è·¯å¾„æ€»å’ŒII(No.113)

class Solution113:
    def pathSum(self, root: Optional[TreeNode], targetSum: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(root,target):
            if not root:
                return

            path.append(root.val)
            if not root.left and not root.right and target == root.val:
                res.append(list(path))

            dfs(root.left, target-root.val)
            dfs(root.right, target-root.val)
            path.pop()

        res,path = [],[]
        dfs(root,targetSum)
        return res

6.2.3 è·¯å¾„æ€»å’ŒIII(No.437)

class Solution437:
    def pathSum(self, root: TreeNode, targetSum: int) -> int:
        # DFS
        def dfs(root,target):
            if not root:
                return

            if target - root.val == 0:
                self.res += 1

            dfs(root.left,target-root.val)
            dfs(root.right,target-root.val)

        # éå†æ•´ä¸ªæ ‘
        def preorder(root):
            if not root:
                return

            dfs(root,targetSum)
            preorder(root.left)
            preorder(root.right)

        # åŒé€’å½’
        self.res = 0
        preorder(root)
        return self.res

6.2.4 æ±‚æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹åˆ°å¶èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°å­—ä¹‹å’Œ(No.129)

class Solution129:
    def sumNumbers(self, root: TreeNode) -> int:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(root):
            if not root:
                return
            path.append(root.val)
            if not root.left and not root.right:
                temp = 0
                for num in path:
		    temp = temp*10 + num
                self.res += temp

            dfs(root.left)
            dfs(root.right)
            path.pop()

        self.res,path = 0,[]
        dfs(root)
        return self.res

6.2.5 éªŒè¯äºŒå‰æœç´¢æ ‘(No.98)

class Solution98:
    def isValidBST(self, root: TreeNode) -> bool:
        # ä¸­åºéå†,åˆ¤æ–­å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹æ˜¯å¦å¤§äºå‰èŠ‚ç‚¹
        def recur(root):
            if not root:
                return True

            left = recur(root.left)
            if not left:
                return False

            if root.val <= self.pre:
                return False

            self.pre = root.val
            return recur(root.right)

        self.pre = float('-inf')
        return recur(root)

6.2.6 ç›¸åŒçš„æ ‘(No.100)

class Solution100:
    def isSameTree(self, p: TreeNode, q: TreeNode) -> bool:
        if not p and not q:
            return True
        
        if not p or not q:
            return False

        if p.val == q.val:
            return self.isSameTree(p.left,q.left) and self.isSameTree(p.right,q.right)
        else:
            return False

6.2.7 å¦ä¸€æ£µæ ‘çš„å­æ ‘(No.572)

class Solution572:
    def isSubtree(self, root: TreeNode, subRoot: TreeNode) -> bool:
        # éå†æ¯ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œåˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯ç›¸åŒçš„æ ‘
        if not root:
            return False

        return self.is_same_tree(root,subRoot) or self.isSubtree(root.left,subRoot) or self.isSubtree(root.right,subRoot)

    def is_same_tree(self,a,b):
            if not a and not b:
                return True
            if not a or not b:
                return False

            if a.val == b.val:
                return self.is_same_tree(a.left,b.left) and self.is_same_tree(a.right,b.right)
            else:
                return False

7. DFS/å›æº¯ç®—æ³•

7.1 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

7.1.1 å­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„æ’åˆ—(No.JZ38)

class SolutionJZ38(object):
    def permutation(self, s):
        """
        :type s: str
        :rtype: List[str]
        """
        c,res = list(s),[]
        def recur(x):
            if x == len(c) - 1:
                res.append(''.join(c))
                return

            # å»é‡
            d = set()
            for i in range(x,len(c)):
                if c[i] in d:
                    continue

                d.add(c[i])
                # æ¢å›ºå®šç‚¹
                c[i], c[x] = c[x], c[i]
                recur(x+1)
                # å›æº¯
                c[i], c[x] = c[x], c[i]

        recur(0)
        return res

        # res,path = [],[]
        # char = list(s)
        # def recur(n,used):
        #     if len(path)==n:
        #         res.append(''.join(path))
        #         return

        #     d = set()
        #     for i in range(n):
        #         if used[i] == 1: continue
        #         if char[i] in d: continue
        #         d.add(char[i])
        #         path.append(char[i])
        #         used[i] = 1
        #         recur(n,used)
        #         path.pop()
        #         used[i] = 0


        # used = [0] * len(char)
        # recur(len(char),used)
        # return res

7.1.2 å­é›†(No.78)

class Solution78(object):
    def subsets(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: List[List[int]]
        """
        res,path = [[]],[]
        def recur(n,idx):
            if idx==n:
                return

            for i in range(idx,n):
                path.append(nums[i])
                res.append(list(path))
                recur(n,i+1)
                path.pop()

        recur(len(nums),0)
        return res

7.1.3 ç»„åˆ(No.77)

class Solution77:
    def combine(self, n: int, k: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        # å›æº¯
        def recur(idx):
            if len(path) == k:
                res.append(list(path))
                return

            # for i in range(idx,n):
            for i in range(idx,n - (k-len(path)) + 1):  # å‰ªæ
                path.append(nums[i])
                recur(i+1)
                path.pop()

        nums = [i+1 for i in range(n)]
        res,path = [],[]
        recur(0)
        return res

7.1.4 å…¨æ’åˆ—(No.46)

class Solution46(object):
    def permute(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: List[List[int]]
        """
        res,path = [],[]
        def recur(n,used):
            if len(path)==n:
                res.append(list(path))  # ç”±äºlistæ˜¯å¯å˜å¯¹è±¡ï¼Œæ­¤å¤„ä¸èƒ½ç›´æ¥append
                return
            
            for i in range(n):
                if used[i]: continue
                used[i] = 1
                path.append(nums[i])
                recur(n,used)
                path.pop()
                used[i] = 0
        
        used = [0] * len(nums)
        recur(len(nums),used)
        return res

7.1.5 å…¨æ’åˆ—II(No.47)

class Solution47:
    def permuteUnique(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
        def recur(used):
            if len(path) == n:
                res.append(list(path))
                return 

            dic = set()
            for i in range(n):
                if used[i]: continue
                if nums[i] in dic: continue  # å»é‡
                # if i>0 and nums[i] == nums[i-1] and not used[i-1]: continue éœ€å¯¹æ•°ç»„å…ˆæ’åº
                dic.add(nums[i])
                path.append(nums[i])
                used[i] = 1
                recur(used)
                used[i] = 0
                path.pop()

        res, path = [], []
        n = len(nums)
        used = [0] * n
        recur(used)
        return res

7.1.6 å•è¯æœç´¢(No.79)

class Solution79:
    def exist(self, board: List[List[str]], word: str) -> bool:
    	# å›æº¯
        def dfs(i,j,idx):
            if idx == n:
                return True

            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == len(board) or j == len(board[0]): 
                return False

            if board[i][j] != word[idx] or board[i][j] == 0:
                return False

            temp = board[i][j]
            board[i][j] = 0
            res = dfs(i-1,j,idx+1) or dfs(i+1,j,idx+1) or dfs(i,j-1,idx+1) or dfs(i,j+1,idx+1)
            board[i][j] = temp
            return res

        n = len(word)
        for i in range(len(board)):
            for j in range(len(board[0])):
                if board[i][j] == word[0]:
                    if dfs(i,j,0):
                        return True
        
        return False

7.1.7 æ’åˆ—åºåˆ—(No.60)

class Solution60:
    def getPermutation(self, n: int, k: int) -> str:
        # DFS + å‰ªæ
        def dfs(k,idx):
            if idx == n:
                return 
            
            cnt = jiecheng[n-1-idx]
            for i in range(n):
                if uesd[i]: continue
                if cnt < k:
                    k -= cnt
                    continue

                path.append(str(nums[i]))
                uesd[i] = 1
                dfs(k,idx + 1)
                return   # ç›´æ¥è¿”å›å³å¯ï¼Œåç»­çš„ä¸ç”¨éå†

        nums = [i+1 for i in range(n)]
        path = []
        uesd = [0] * n
        jiecheng = [1] * n
        for i in range(1,n):
            jiecheng[i] = i * jiecheng[i-1]
        dfs(k,0)
        return ''.join(path)

        # æŒ‰ä½æ‰¾è§„å¾‹ï¼Œä½ä¸Šçš„å€¼ç¡®å®šï¼šnum = nums[k // jc] if k % jc else nums[k // jc - 1]
        # def jiecheng(n):
        #     res = 1
        #     while n > 1:
        #         res *= n
        #         n = n-1

        #     return res

        # def recur(n,k):
        #     if n == 0:
        #         return
        #     jc = (jiecheng(n-1))
        #     num = nums[k // jc] if k % jc else nums[k // jc - 1]
        #     nums.remove(num)
        #     res.append(str(num))
        #     k = k % jc
        #     recur(n-1,k)

        # nums = [i+1 for i in range(n)]
        # res = []
        # recur(n,k)
        # return ''.join(res)

7.1.8 çŸ©é˜µä¸­çš„è·¯å¾„(No.JZ12)

class SolutionJZ12:
    def exist(self, board: List[List[str]], word: str) -> bool:
        def dfs(i,j,idx):
            if i<0 or j<0 or i>=m or j>=n or board[i][j] != word[idx]:
                return False

            if idx == len(word) - 1:
                return True

            temp = board[i][j]
            board[i][j] = 0
            res = dfs(i-1,j,idx+1) or dfs(i+1,j,idx+1) or dfs(i,j-1,idx+1) or dfs(i,j+1,idx+1)
            board[i][j] = temp
            return res

        m, n = len(board), len(board[0])
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                if board[i][j] == word[0]:
                    if dfs(i,j,0): return True

        return False

7.1.9 å²›å±¿æ•°é‡(No.200)

class Solution200(object):
    def numIslands(self, grid):
        """
        :type grid: List[List[str]]
        :rtype: int
        """
        # DFS
        def dfs(i,j):
            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == m or j == n or grid[i][j] == "0":
                return

            grid[i][j] = "0"
            dfs(i-1,j)
            dfs(i+1,j)
            dfs(i,j-1)
            dfs(i,j+1)
            return

        # BFS
        def bfs(i,j):
            quene = [[i,j]]
            while quene:
                i,j = quene.pop(0)
                if i >= 0 and j >=0 and i < m and j < n and grid[i][j] == "1":
                    grid[i][j] = "0"
                    quene + [bfs(i-1,j),bfs(i+1,j),bfs(i,j-1),bfs(i,j+1)]

        m,n = len(grid), len(grid[0])
        res = 0
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == "1":
                    dfs(i,j)
                    res += 1

        return res<Paste>

7.1.10 å²›å±¿çš„æœ€å¤§é¢ç§¯(No.695)

class Solution695:
    def maxAreaOfIsland(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        # DFS
        def dfs(i,j):
            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == m or j == n or grid[i][j] == 0:
                return 0

            grid[i][j] = 0
            return 1 + dfs(i-1,j) + dfs(i+1,j) + dfs(i,j-1) + dfs(i,j+1)


        m,n = len(grid),len(grid[0])
        res = 0
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == 1:
                    res = max(res, dfs(i,j))

        return res

7.1.11 ä¸åŒå²›å±¿çš„æ•°é‡(No.694)

class Solution694:
    def numDistinctIslands(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        # DFS+è·¯å¾„å»é‡
        def dfs(i,j,o_i,o_j):
            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == m or j == n or grid[i][j] == 0:
                return
            
            grid[i][j] = 0
            # è®°å½•ç›¸å¯¹è·¯å¾„
            temp.append(str(i-o_i))
            temp.append(str(j-o_j))
            dfs(i-1,j,o_i,o_j)
            dfs(i+1,j,o_i,o_j)
            dfs(i,j-1,o_i,o_j)
            dfs(i,j+1,o_i,o_j)
            return

        m,n = len(grid),len(grid[0])
        res = set()
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == 1:
                     temp = []
                     dfs(i,j,i,j)
                     res.add(''.join(temp))

        return len(res)

7.1.12 å²›å±¿çš„å‘¨é•¿(No.463)

class Solution463:
    def islandPerimeter(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        # DFS ç¢°åˆ°æ°´æˆ–è€…è¶Šç•Œæ¬¡æ•°ç­‰äºå‘¨é•¿
        def dfs(i,j):
            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == m or j == n or grid[i][j] == 0:
                return 1

            if grid[i][j] == 2:  # èµ°è¿‡çš„è·¯ï¼Œä¸èƒ½æ ‡è®°ä¸º0äº†
                return 0

            grid[i][j] = 2
            return dfs(i-1,j) + dfs(i+1,j) + dfs(i,j-1) + dfs(i,j+1)
            
        m,n = len(grid),len(grid[0])
        for i in range(m):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == 1:
                    return dfs(i,j)

7.1.13 æœ€å¤§äººå·¥å²›(No.827)

class Solution827:
    def largestIsland(self, grid: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        # DFS
        def dfs(i,j,idx):
            if i < 0 or j < 0 or i == n or j == n or grid[i][j] != 1:
                return 0

            grid[i][j] = idx  # å²›å±¿åºå·ï¼Œ2,3,4ï¼Œ...
            return 1 + dfs(i-1,j,idx) + dfs(i+1,j,idx) + dfs(i,j-1,idx) + dfs(i,j+1,idx)

        def final_area(i,j):
            area,idxs = 0,set()
            dirs = [(-1,0),(1,0),(0,-1),(0,1)]  # å››ä¸ªæ–¹å‘
            for d in dirs:
                n_i,n_j = i + d[0], j + d[1]
                if n_i < 0 or n_j < 0 or n_i == n or n_j == n or  grid[n_i][n_j] == 0:
                    continue
                idx = grid[n_i][n_j]
                if idx not in idxs:  # åªè€ƒè™‘idxä¸åŒçš„
                    idxs.add(idx)
                    area += dic[idx]
                else:
                    continue

            return 1 + area

        n,idx,dic,res = len(grid),2,dict(),0
        # éå†é™†åœ°ï¼Œè®¡ç®—å²›å±¿é¢ç§¯å¹¶æ ‡è®°åºå·
        for i in range(n):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == 1:
                    area = dfs(i,j,idx)
                    dic[idx] = area  # åºå·:é¢ç§¯
                    idx += 1
                    res = max(res, area)
        
        if res == 0: return 1  # æ— é™†åœ°ï¼Œé€ 1
        # éå†æµ·æ´‹ï¼Œè®¡ç®—å‘¨å›´å²›å±¿æ€»é¢ç§¯
        for i in range(n):
            for j in range(n):
                if grid[i][j] == 0:
                    res = max(res, final_area(i,j))

        return res

7.1.14 ç»„åˆæ€»å’Œ(No.39)

class Solution39:
    def combinationSum(self, candidates: List[int], target: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        # åŠ¨æ€è§„åˆ’ï¼Œå®Œå…¨èƒŒåŒ…æ±‚å…·ä½“æ–¹æ¡ˆ, dp[j]è¡¨ç¤ºå’Œä¸ºjçš„ç»„åˆæ–¹æ¡ˆ
        # m,n = len(candidates), target+1
        # dp = {i:[] for i in range(n)}
        # for i in range(m):
        #     for j in range(n):
        #         if j > candidates[i]:
        #             dp[j].extend([x+[candidates[i]] for x in dp[j-candidates[i]]])
        #         elif j == candidates[i]:
        #             dp[j].extend([[candidates[i]]])
                    
        # return dp[target]

        # å›æº¯+å‰ªæ
        def dfs(idx,target):
            if target==0:
                res.append(list(path))
                return
            if target < 0: return

            for i in range(idx,n):
                # å‰ªæ
                if target < candidates[i]:
                    break
                target -= candidates[i]
                path.append(candidates[i])
                dfs(i,target)  # æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ å¯ä»¥é‡å¤åˆ©ç”¨ï¼Œå› æ­¤ä»iå¼€å§‹
                target += candidates[i]
                path.pop()

        res,path = [],[]
        candidates = sorted(candidates)  # æ’åºæ˜¯å‰ªæçš„å‰æ
        n = len(candidates)
        dfs(0,target)
        return res

7.1.15 å­é›†II(No.90)

class Solution90:
    def subsetsWithDup(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]:
    	# å›æº¯
        def dfs(idx):
            if idx == n:
                return

            for i in range(idx,n):
                if i > idx and nums[i] == nums[i-1]: continue  # åŒä¸€æ ‘å±‚å»é‡
                path.append(nums[i])
                res.append(list(path))
                dfs(i+1)
                path.pop()

        res,path = [[]],[]
        nums = sorted(nums)  # å»é‡å‰éœ€æ’åº
        n = len(nums)
        dfs(0)
        return res

7.2 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

7.2.1 ç»„åˆæ€»å’ŒII(No.40)

class Solution40:
    def combinationSum2(self, candidates: List[int], target: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(idx, target):
            if target == 0:
                res.append(list(path))
                return
            if target < 0: return 

            for i in range(idx, n):
                if i > idx and candidates[i] == candidates[i-1]:  # æ ‘å±‚å»é‡
                    continue
                if target < candidates[i]:  # å‰ªæ
                    break
                target -= candidates[i]
                path.append(candidates[i])
                dfs(i+1, target)
                target += candidates[i]
                path.pop()

        n = len(candidates)
        candidates = sorted(candidates)
        res,path = [],[]
        dfs(0,target)
        return res

7.2.2 ç»„åˆæ€»å’ŒIII(No.216)

class Solution216:
    def combinationSum3(self, k: int, n: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(idx, target):
            if len(path) == k and target == 0:
                res.append(list(path))
                return
            if target < 0 or len(path) > k:
                return

            for i in range(idx,9):
                if target < nums[i]:  # å‰ªæ
                    break
                target -= nums[i]
                path.append(nums[i])
                dfs(i+1,target)
                target += nums[i]
                path.pop()

        nums = [i+1 for i in range(9)]
        res, path = [],[]
        dfs(0,n)
        return res

7.2.3 ç”µè¯å·ç çš„å­—æ¯ç»„åˆ(No.17)

class Solution17:
    def letterCombinations(self, digits: str) -> List[str]:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(idx):
            if idx == n:
                res.append(''.join(path))
                return

            num = digits[idx]
            # éå†æ¯ä¸ªæ•°å­—å¯¹åº”çš„å­—æ¯
            for char in dic[num]:
                path.append(char)
                dfs(idx+1)
                path.pop()


        if not digits: return []
        dic = {'2':'abc','3':'def','4':'ghi','5':'jkl','6':'mno','7':'pqrs','8':'tuv','9':'wxyz'}
        res,path,n = [],[],len(digits)
        dfs(0)
        return res

        # é˜Ÿåˆ—
        # if not digits: return []
        # quene = ['']
        # dic = {'2':'abc','3':'def','4':'ghi','5':'jkl','6':'mno','7':'pqrs','8':'tuv','9':'wxyz'}
        # for num in digits:
        #     chars = dic[num]
        #     size = len(quene)
        #     for i in range(size):
        #         temp = quene.pop(0)
        #         for char in chars:
        #             quene.append(temp+char)

        # return quene

7.2.4 åˆ†å‰²å›æ–‡ä¸²(No.131)

class Solution131:
    def partition(self, s: str) -> List[List[str]]:
        # å›æº¯
        def is_huiwen(s):
            return s == s[::-1]

        def dfs(idx):
            if idx == n:
                res.append(list(path))
                return
            
            for i in range(idx, n):
                head = s[idx:i+1]
                # if not is_huiwen(head):  # å¦‚æœå‰ç¼€ä¸æ˜¯å›æ–‡ï¼Œç›´æ¥è·³è¿‡
                if not dp[idx][i]:
                    continue
                path.append(head)
                dfs(i+1)
                path.pop()

        # ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼ŒåŠ¨æ€è§„åˆ’æ±‚æ¯ä¸ªå­ä¸²æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºå›æ–‡ä¸²,dp[i][j]è¡¨ç¤ºs[i:j+1]æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºå›æ–‡ä¸²
        res,path,n = [],[],len(s)
        dp = [[False]*n for _ in range(n)]
        for i in range(n):
            dp[i][i] = True

        for i in range(n-1,-1,-1):
            for j in range(i+1,n):
                dp[i][j] = s[i] == s[j] and (dp[i+1][j-1] or j-i==1)

        dfs(0)
        return res

7.2.5 å¤åŸIPåœ°å€(No.93)

class Solution93:
    def restoreIpAddresses(self, s: str) -> List[str]:
        # å›æº¯
        def dfs(idx):
            if (n-idx) > (4-len(path))*3 or (n-idx) < (4-len(path)):  # å‰ªæ
                return

            if idx == n:
                if len(path)==4:
                    res.append('.'.join(path))
                return

            if idx+3>n:
                right = n
            else:
                right = idx + 3
            for i in range(idx,right):
                num = s[idx:i+1]
                if int(num) > 255 or (len(num) > 1 and num[0] == '0'): 
                    continue
                path.append(num)
                dfs(i+1)
                path.pop()
                
            
        res,path,n = [],[],len(s)
        dfs(0)
        return res

7.2.6 äºŒå‰æ ‘ä¸­çš„æœ€å¤§è·¯å¾„å’Œ(No.124)

class Solution124:
    def maxPathSum(self, root: TreeNode) -> int:
        def dfs(root):
            if not root:
                return 0

            left = dfs(root.left)
            right = dfs(root.right)
            # å½“å‰å­æ ‘çš„æœ€å¤§è·¯å¾„å’Œ
            cur_sum = root.val + left + right
            self.res = max(self.res, cur_sum)
            # ä½œä¸ºå­æ ‘å¯¹å¤–çš„æœ€å¤§è·¯å¾„å’Œ
            out_sum = max(left+root.val, right+root.val)
            return out_sum if out_sum > 0 else 0

        self.res = -float('inf')  # è€ƒè™‘è´Ÿæ•°æƒ…å†µï¼Œä¸èƒ½è®¾ä¸º0
        dfs(root)
        return self.res

7.2.7 Nçš‡å(No.51)

class Solution51:
    def solveNQueens(self, n: int) -> List[List[str]]:
        # å›æº¯ï¼Œæ¯è¡Œåªèƒ½æ”¾ä¸€ä¸ªçš‡å
        def dfs(row):
            if row == n:
                res.append([''.join(i) for i in grid])
                return

            # éå†åˆ—
            for i in range(n):
                if is_valid(row,i):
                    grid[row][i] = 'Q'
                    dfs(row+1)
                    grid[row][i] = '.'

            return

        def is_valid(row,col):
            for i in range(row):
                if grid[row-i-1][col] == 'Q':  # ä¸Šæ–¹
                    return False
                if col-i-1>=0 and grid[row-i-1][col-i-1] == 'Q':  # å·¦ä¸Šæ–¹
                    return False
                if col+i+1<n and grid[row-i-1][col+i+1] == 'Q':  # å³ä¸Šæ–¹
                    return False

            return True
            
        res = []
        grid = [['.']*n for _ in range(n)]
        dfs(0)
        return res

7.2.8 æ‹¬å·ç”Ÿæˆ(No.22)

class Solution22:
    def generateParenthesis(self, n: int) -> List[str]:
        # å›æº¯,left,rightåˆ†åˆ«ä¸ºå·¦å³æ‹¬å·å‰©ä½™ä¸ªæ•°
        def dfs(left,right):
            if left==0 and right==0:
                res.append(''.join(path))
                return

            # ä¸æ»¡è¶³æœ‰æ•ˆæ‹¬å·
            if left>right:
                return

            if left > 0:
                path.append('(')
                left -= 1
                dfs(left,right)
                left += 1
                path.pop()

            if right > 0:
                path.append(')')
                right -= 1
                dfs(left,right)
                right += 1
                path.pop()

        res,path = [],[]
        dfs(n,n)
        return res

8. æ ˆã€é˜Ÿåˆ—ã€å †

8.1 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

8.1.1 ç”¨ä¸¤ä¸ªæ ˆå®ç°é˜Ÿåˆ—(No.JZ9)

class CQueue(jobject):

    def __init__(self):
        self.s1 = []
        self.s2 = []

    def appendTail(self, value):
        """
        :type value: int
        :rtype: None
        """
        self.s1.append(value)

    def deleteHead(self):
        """
        :rtype: int
        """
        # å°†s1ä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ ä¾æ¬¡å‡ºæ ˆåˆ°s2ä¸­
        if self.s2:
            return self.s2.pop()
        else:
            if self.s1:
                for i in range(len(self.s1)):
                    self.s2.append(self.s1.pop())
                return self.s2.pop()
            else:
                return -1

8.1.2 æ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼(No.JZ59I)

class SolutionJZ59I(object):
    def maxSlidingWindow(self, nums, k):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :type k: int
        :rtype: List[int]
        """
        if not nums:
            return []

        # åŠ¨æ€è§„åˆ’
        # dp = [0] * (len(nums)-k+1)
        # dp[0] = max(nums[:k])
        # for i in range(1, len(dp)):
        #     if nums[i-1] != dp[i-1]:
        #         dp[i] = max(dp[i-1], nums[i + k - 1])
        #     else:
        #         dp[i] = max(nums[i:i+k])

        # return dp

        # å•è°ƒé˜Ÿåˆ—
        res, quene = [], []
        for i,j in zip(range(1-k,len(nums)-k+1), range(len(nums))):
            if i > 0 and quene[0] == nums[i-1]:
                quene.pop(0)
            while quene and quene[-1] < nums[j]:
                quene.pop()
            quene.append(nums[j])
            if i >= 0:
                res.append(quene[0])

        return res

8.1.3 åŒ…å«minå‡½æ•°çš„æ ˆ(No.JZ30)

class MinStack:

    def __init__(self):
        """
        initialize your data structure here.
        """
        self.stack = []
        # è¾…åŠ©æ ˆ,å•è°ƒå‡
        self.m = []


    def push(self, x: int) -> None:
        self.stack.append(x)
        if not self.m or x <= self.m[-1]:
            self.m.append(x)

    def pop(self) -> None:
        num = self.stack.pop()
        if num == self.m[-1]:
            self.m.pop()

    def top(self) -> int:
        return self.stack[-1]

    def min(self) -> int:
        return self.m[-1]

8.1.4 é˜Ÿåˆ—çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼(No.JZ59II)

class MaxQueue:

    def __init__(self):
        self.a = []
        self.b = []

    def max_value(self) -> int:
        if not self.b:
            return -1
        else:
            return self.b[0]

    def push_back(self, value: int) -> None:
        self.a.append(value)
        # ç»´æŠ¤ä¸€ä¸ªåŒç«¯é˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œåˆ é™¤é˜Ÿåˆ—ä¸­æ‰€æœ‰å°äºæ–°å…¥é˜Ÿçš„å…ƒç´ ï¼Œä¿æŒå•è°ƒå‡
        while self.b and self.b[-1] < value:
            self.b.pop()

        self.b.append(value)

    def pop_front(self) -> int:
        if not self.a:
            return -1
        num = self.a.pop(0)
        if num == self.b[0]:
            self.b.pop(0)

        return num

8.1.5 æ•°æ®æµä¸­çš„ä¸­ä½æ•°(No.JZ41)

class MedianFinder:

    def __init__(self):
        """
        initialize your data structure here.
        """
        # self.quene = []
        self.a = []  # å°é¡¶å †ï¼Œå­˜è¾ƒå¤§çš„ä¸€åŠæ•°
        self.b = []  # å¤§é¡¶å †ï¼Œå­˜è¾ƒå°çš„ä¸€åŠæ•°

    def addNum(self, num: int) -> None:
        # é˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œä¿æŒæ•°ç»„æœ‰åº
        # if not self.quene:
        #     self.quene.append(num)
        #     return

        # l,r = 0,len(self.quene)-1
        # while l<=r:
        #     mid = (l+r)//2
        #     if self.quene[mid] > num:
        #         r = mid - 1
        #     else:
        #         l = mid + 1
        # self.quene.insert(l,num)

        # å †
        if len(self.a) == len(self.b):
            heapq.heappush(self.b, -num)
            heapq.heappush(self.a, -heapq.heappop(self.b))
        else:
            heapq.heappush(self.a, num)
            heapq.heappush(self.b, -heapq.heappop(self.a))

    def findMedian(self) -> float:
        # m = (len(self.quene)-1) // 2
        # if len(self.quene) % 2 == 1:
        #     return self.quene
        # else:
        #     return (self.quene[m] + self.quene[m+1])/2

        if len(self.a) == len(self.b):
            return (self.a[0] - self.b[0]) / 2
        else:
            return self.a[0]

8.1.6 æ ˆçš„å‹å…¥ã€å¼¹å‡ºåºåˆ—(No.JZ31)

class SolutionJZ31:
    def validateStackSequences(self, pushed: List[int], popped: List[int]) -> bool:
        # è¾…åŠ©æ ˆï¼Œæ¨¡æ‹Ÿè¿‡ç¨‹
        stack,i = [],0
        for num in pushed:
            stack.append(num)
            while stack and stack[-1]==popped[i]:
                stack.pop()
                i += 1

        return not stack

8.1.7 æœ‰æ•ˆçš„æ‹¬å·(No.20)

class Solution20:
    def isValid(self, s: str) -> bool:
        # è¾…åŠ©æ ˆ
        stack = []
        for i in range(0,len(s)):
            if not stack:
                stack.append(s[i])
            elif stack[-1]=='(' and s[i]==')' or stack[-1]=='{' and s[i]=='}' or stack[-1]=='[' and s[i]==']':
                stack.pop()
            else:
                stack.append(s[i])

        return False if stack else True

8.1.8 å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è§£ç (No.394)

class Solution394:
    def decodeString(self, s: str) -> str:
        # è¾…åŠ©æ ˆï¼Œæ¶‰åŠæ‹¬å·åŒ¹é…é—®é¢˜é€‚åˆç”¨æ ˆæ¥è§£å†³
        stack,res,num = [],'',0
        for char in s:
            if '0' <= char <= '9':
                num = num*10 + int(char)  # è½¬æ•°å­—ï¼Œè€ƒè™‘å¤šä½æ•°å­—æƒ…å†µ
            elif char == '[':
                stack.append((res,num))
                res,num = '',0
            elif char == ']':
                last_res, last_num = stack.pop()
                res = last_res + last_num * res
            else:
                res += char

        return res

8.1.9 æ¯æ—¥æ¸©åº¦(No.739)

class Solution739:
    def dailyTemperatures(self, temperatures: List[int]) -> List[int]:
        # å•è°ƒæ ˆï¼Œæ ˆä¸­è®°å½•å…ƒç´ ä¸‹æ ‡å³å¯
        n = len(temperatures)
        res = [0] * n
        stack = [0]
        for i in range(1,n):
            while stack and temperatures[i] > temperatures[stack[-1]]:
                idx = stack.pop()
                res[idx] = i - idx
            
            stack.append(i)

        return res

8.1.10 åŸºæœ¬è®¡ç®—å™¨(No.224,No.227,No.772)

class Solution224:
    def calculate(self, s: str) -> int:
        # åŒæ ˆå¤„ç†ï¼Œé€šç”¨æ¨¡æ¿
        def calc(num_stack,op_stack):
            y,x = num_stack.pop(),num_stack.pop()
            op = op_stack.pop()
            if op == '+':
                ans = x + y
            elif op == '-':
                ans = x - y
            elif op == '*':
                ans = x * y
            elif op == '/':
                ans = x // y

            num_stack.append(ans)

        priority = {'+':1,'-':1,'*':2,'/':2}
        # é¢„å¤„ç†å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œå¤„ç†ç©ºæ ¼ï¼Œé¦–ä½è¡¥é›¶
        s = '(' + s.replace(' ','').replace('(-','(0-') +')'
        n = len(s)
        num_stack,op_stack = [0],[]  # åˆ†åˆ«å­˜æ•°å­—å’Œè¿ç®—ç¬¦ï¼Œé˜²æ­¢ä¸ºè´Ÿæ•°numéœ€æ·»0
        i= 0
        while i < n:
            c = s[i]
            i += 1

            if c.isdigit():  # æ•°å­—
                num = int(c)
                while i < n and s[i].isdigit():
                    num = num * 10 + int(s[i])
                    i += 1
                num_stack.append(num)
            elif c == '(':
                op_stack.append(c)
            elif c== ')': 
                # è®¡ç®—ç›´è‡³é‡åˆ°'('
                while op_stack and op_stack[-1] != '(':
                    calc(num_stack, op_stack)
                op_stack.pop()
            else:
                while op_stack and op_stack[-1] != '(':
                    prev_op = op_stack[-1]
                    # åªæœ‰ã€Œæ ˆå†…è¿ç®—ç¬¦ã€æ¯”ã€Œå½“å‰è¿ç®—ç¬¦ã€ä¼˜å…ˆçº§é«˜/åŒç­‰ï¼Œæ‰è¿›è¡Œè¿ç®—
                    if priority[prev_op] < priority[c]:   
                        break
                    calc(num_stack, op_stack)
                op_stack.append(c)
            
        return num_stack[-1]

8.1.11 æŸ±çŠ¶å›¾ä¸­æœ€å¤§çš„çŸ©å½¢(No.84)

class Solution84:
    def largestRectangleArea(self, heights: List[int]) -> int:
        n = len(heights)
        res = 0
        # å…ˆæ”¾å…¥å“¨å…µç»“ç‚¹ï¼Œåœ¨å¾ªç¯ä¸­å°±ä¸ç”¨åšéç©ºåˆ¤æ–­
        heights = [0] + heights + [0]
        stack = [0]
        n += 2

        for i in range(1, n):
            while heights[i] < heights[stack[-1]]:
                cur_height = heights[stack.pop()]
                cur_width = i - stack[-1] - 1
                res = max(res, cur_height * cur_width)
            stack.append(i)
        return res

9. æ’åº

9.1 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

9.1.1 æ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„é€†åºå¯¹(No.JZ51)

class SolutionJZ51(object):
    def reversePairs(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: int
        """
        # æš´åŠ›è§£æ³•è¶…æ—¶
        # res = 0
        # for i in range(len(nums)):
        #     for j in range(i+1,len(nums)):
        #         if nums[i] > nums[j]:
        #             res += 1
        
        # return res

        # å½’å¹¶æ’åº
        def merge_sort(l,r):
            if l >= r:
                return 0

            mid = (l + r) // 2
            res = merge_sort(l, mid) + merge_sort(mid+1, r)

            # merge
            i, j = l, mid + 1
            temp[l:r+1] = nums[l:r+1]
            for k in range(l, r+1):
                if i == mid+1:
                    nums[k] = temp[j]
                    j += 1
                elif j == r + 1 or temp[i] <= temp[j]:
                    nums[k] = temp[i]
                    i += 1
                elif temp[i] > temp[j]:
                    nums[k] = temp[j]
                    j += 1
                    res += mid - i + 1

            return res


        temp = [0] * len(nums)
        res = merge_sort(0,len(nums)-1)
        return res

9.1.2 æœ€å°çš„kä¸ªæ•°(No.JZ40)

class SolutionJZ40(object):
    def getLeastNumbers(self, arr, k):
        """
        :type arr: List[int]
        :type k: int
        :rtype: List[int]
        """
        # return sorted(arr)[:k]

        # å¿«æ’
        # def sort(l,r):
        #     if l >= r:
        #         return

        #     i,j = l,r
        #     while i < j:
        #         while i < j and arr[j]>=arr[l]: j -= 1
        #         while i < j and arr[i]<=arr[l]: i += 1
        #         arr[i], arr[j] = arr[j], arr[i]

        #     arr[l],arr[i] = arr[i], arr[l]
        #     sort(l,i-1)
        #     sort(i+1,r)

        # sort(0,len(arr)-1)
        # return arr[:k]

        # å¿«æ’ä¼˜åŒ–
        def sort(l,r):
            if l >= r:
                return

            i,j = l,r
            while i < j:
                while i < j and arr[j]>=arr[l]: j -= 1
                while i < j and arr[i]<=arr[l]: i += 1
                arr[i], arr[j] = arr[j], arr[i]

            arr[l],arr[i] = arr[i], arr[l]
            if i + 1 == k:
                return
            elif i + 1 > k: 
                sort(l,i-1)
            else:
                sort(i+1,r)

        sort(0,len(arr)-1)
        return arr[:k]

9.1.3 æŠŠæ•°ç»„æ’æˆæœ€å°çš„æ•°(No.JZ45)

class SolutionJZ45(object):
    def minNumber(self, nums):
        """
        :type nums: List[int]
        :rtype: str
        """
        # è‡ªå®šä¹‰æ’åºè§„åˆ™+å¿«é€Ÿæ’åº
        def quick_sort(l,r):
            if l >= r: return
            i,j = l,r
            while i < j:
                while i < j and int(nums[j]+nums[l]) >= int(nums[l]+nums[j]): j -= 1
                while i < j and int(nums[i]+nums[l]) <= int(nums[l]+nums[i]): i += 1
                nums[i], nums[j] = nums[j], nums[i]

            nums[l],nums[i] = nums[i], nums[l]
            quick_sort(l,i-1)
            quick_sort(i+1,r)

        nums = [str(i) for i in nums]
        quick_sort(0,len(nums)-1)
        return ''.join(nums)

9.1.4 æ•°ç»„ä¸­çš„ç¬¬Kä¸ªæœ€å¤§å…ƒç´ (No.215)

class Solution215:
    def findKthLargest(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:
        def quick_sort(l,r):
            if l >= r:
                return

            i,j = l,r
            base = (l+r)//2
            nums[base],nums[l] = nums[l],nums[base]
            while i < j:
                while i < j and nums[j] <= nums[l]: j -= 1
                while i < j and nums[i] >= nums[l]: i += 1
                nums[i],nums[j] = nums[j],nums[i]

            nums[l],nums[i] = nums[i],nums[l]

            if i == k-1:
                return
            elif i > k-1:
                quick_sort(l,i-1)
            else:
                quick_sort(i+1,r)

        # å¿«æ’
        # n = len(nums) - 1
        # quick_sort(0,n)
        # return nums[k-1]

        # å †æ’
        heap = []
        for i in nums:
            heapq.heappush(heap,i)
            if len(heap) > k:
                heapq.heappop(heap)

        return heap[0]

10. ä½è¿ç®—

10.1 å…¸å‹ä¾‹é¢˜

10.1.1 æ•°ç»„ä¸­æ•°å­—å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°(No.JZ56I)

class SolutionJZ56I:
    def singleNumbers(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[int]:
        # å¼‚æˆ–^å¯ä»¥å‰”é™¤å‡ºç°2æ¬¡çš„æ•°å­—
        ans = 0
        for i in nums:
            ans ^= i
        
        # ans = a ^ b,aã€bå³ä¸ºåªå‡ºç°ä¸€æ¬¡çš„æ•°å­—
        
        m = 1
        while m & ans == 0:
            m <<= 1
        
        a,b = 0,0
        for i in nums:
            if i & m: a ^= i
            else: b ^= i

        return a,b

10.1.2 äºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä¸­1çš„ä¸ªæ•°(No.JZ15)

  • n-1å¯å°†næœ€å³è¾¹çš„1å˜ä¸º0ï¼Œæ­¤1å³è¾¹çš„0éƒ½å˜ä¸º1
  • n&(n-1)å¯å°†næœ€å³è¾¹çš„1å˜æˆ0ï¼Œå…¶ä½™ä¸å˜
    class SolutionJZ15:
    def hammingWeight(self, n: int) -> int:
        # ä½è¿ç®—
        res,point = 0,1
        for i in range(32):
            if n & point:
                res += 1

            point <<= 1

        return res

        # åˆ©ç”¨n&(n-1)
        # res = 0
        # while n:
        #     n &= n-1
        #     res += 1

        # return res

10.1.3 æ•°ç»„ä¸­æ•°å­—å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°II(No.JZ56II)

class SolutionJZ56II:
    def singleNumber(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        # å“ˆå¸Œè¡¨
        # dic = {}
        # for num in nums:
        #     if num not in dic:
        #         dic[num] = 0

        #     dic[num] += 1

        # for i in dic:
        #     if dic[i] == 1:
        #         return i

        # ä½è¿ç®—ï¼Œç»Ÿè®¡å„ä½ä¸Š1çš„ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œå†å¯¹3å–ä½™ï¼Œå‰©ä¸‹çš„å°±æ˜¯ç»“æœ
        arr = [0] * 32
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            for j in range(32):
                arr[j] += nums[i]&1
                nums[i] >>= 1

        res,k = 0,3
        for i in range(32):
            res <<= 1
            res |= arr[31-i] % 3
            
        return res

10.1.4 ä¸ç”¨åŠ å‡ä¹˜é™¤åšåŠ æ³•(No.JZ65)

class SolutionJZ65:
    def add(self, a: int, b: int) -> int:
        # Pythonï¼ŒJava ç­‰è¯­è¨€ä¸­çš„æ•°å­—éƒ½æ˜¯ä»¥è¡¥ç å½¢å¼å­˜å‚¨çš„ã€‚ä½†Pythonæ²¡æœ‰int,longç­‰ä¸åŒé•¿åº¦å˜é‡ï¼Œå³åœ¨ç¼–ç¨‹æ—¶æ— å˜é‡ä½æ•°çš„æ¦‚å¿µ
        x = 0xffffffff
        a,b = a & x,b & x  # å¯ç†è§£ä¸ºèˆå»æ­¤æ•°å­—32ä½ä»¥ä¸Šçš„æ•°å­—ï¼ˆå°†32ä½ä»¥ä¸Šéƒ½å˜ä¸º0ï¼‰ï¼Œä»æ— é™é•¿åº¦å˜ä¸ºä¸€ä¸ª32ä½æ•´æ•°
        while b!=0:
            a,b = a ^ b, (a & b) << 1 & x  # aå­˜å‚¨æ— è¿›ä½å’Œï¼Œbå­˜å‚¨è¿›ä½

        return a if a <= 0x7fffffff else ~(a ^ x)  # è¿˜åŸpythonå­˜å‚¨æ ¼å¼ï¼Œè‹¥ä¸ºè´Ÿæ•°ï¼Œéœ€è¦å°†å¤§äº32çš„æ‰€æœ‰ä½ç½®1

x. å…¶ä»–

x.1 å…¶ä»–ä¾‹é¢˜

x.1.1 xçš„å¹³æ–¹æ ¹(No.69)

class Solution69(object):
    def mySqrt(self, x):
        """
        :type x: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        # äºŒåˆ†æ³•
        # if  x <= 1:
        #     return x

        # left = 1
        # right = x // 2 + 1
        # while right - left > 1:
        #     mid = (left+right)//2
        #     if mid**2 == x:
        #         return mid
        #     elif mid**2 < x:
        #         left = mid
        #     else:
        #         right = mid

        # return left

        # ç‰›é¡¿è¿­ä»£æ³•
        if  x <= 1:
             return x

        x0, C = float(x), float(x)
        while True:
            xi = C/(2*x0) + x0/2
            if x0 - xi < 1e-6:
                break
            x0 = xi

        return int(xi)

x.1.2 1ï½n æ•´æ•°ä¸­ 1 å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°(No.JZ43)

class SolutionJZ43(object):
    def countDigitOne(self, n):
        """
        :type n: int
        :rtype: int
        """
        # ç›´æ¥æš´åŠ›å†…å­˜ç‚¸äº†ï¼Œéœ€è¦ä»ä½æ•°çš„è§’åº¦åˆ†æ
        high = n // 10
        cur = n % 10
        low = 0
        digit = 1
        res = 0
        for i in range(len(str(n))):
            if cur==0:
                res += high*digit
            elif cur==1:
                res += high*digit + low +1
            else:
                res += (high+1)*digit

            low += cur*digit
            cur = high % 10
            high //= 10
            digit *= 10

        return res

x.1.3 Pow(x, n)(No.50)

class Solution50:
    def myPow(self, x: float, n: int) -> float:
        # é€’å½’
        def recur(n):
            if n == 0:
                return 1.0

            ans = recur(n // 2)
            if n % 2:
                return ans * ans * x
            else:
                return ans * ans

        return recur(n) if n>=0 else 1.0/recur(-n)

x.1.4 æ•°å­—åºåˆ—ä¸­æŸä¸€ä½çš„æ•°å­—(No.JZ44)

class SolutionJZ44:
    def findNthDigit(self, n: int) -> int:
        # æ‰¾è§„å¾‹ï¼Œå…ˆç¡®å®šæ•°ä½ï¼Œå†ç¡®å®šå“ªä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œæœ€åç¡®å®šåœ¨æ•°çš„ç¬¬å‡ ä½
        digit, start, count = 1,1,9
        while n > count:
            n -= count
            digit += 1
            start *= 10
            count = 9 * start * digit

        num = start + (n-1)//digit 
        k = (n-1) % digit

        return int(str(num)[k])

x.1.5 ç”¨Rand7()å®ç°Rand10()(No.470)

class Solution470:
    def rand10(self):
        """
        :rtype: int
        """
        # å…³é”®ï¼š(randx() - 1) * y + randy() èƒ½å¤Ÿæ„é€ randx*y()
        num = (rand7() - 1) * 7 + rand7()  # æ„é€ rand49()
        # while num > 10:
        #     num = (rand7() - 1) * 7 + rand7()

        # return num

        while num > 40:
            num = (rand7() - 1) * 7 + rand7()

        return 1 + num % 10

x.1.6 æ•´æ•°åè½¬(No.7)

class Solution7:
    def reverse(self, x: int) -> int:
        sign = 1
        if x < 0:
            sign = 0
            x = -x

        res = 0
        while x > 0:
            digit = x % 10
            # åˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦æº¢å‡º
            if res > (2**31-1)//10 or res == (2**31-1)//10 and digit==7:
                return 0
            x = x // 10
            res = res * 10 + digit

        return res if sign else -res

  • vectorå’ŒarrayåŒºåˆ«
